TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant is a former police officer who was born in DATE and is currently serving a prison sentence in ORG ( GPE - popravni zavod u ORG ) .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG in ORG found the applicant guilty of murdering his former wife , and sentenced him to TIME years’ imprisonment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed this judgment and ordered a retrial .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in Leskovac again convicted the applicant and sentenced him to MONEY . In so doing , it provided extensive reasoning .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld this judgment . The appeal bench included judge PERSON and the applicant received the judgment on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , through the prison authorities and as evidenced by their certificate , the applicant filed an appeal on points of law ( zahtev za ispitivanje zakonitosti pravosnažne presude ) . ORG received this appeal on DATE , as certified by its stamp of even date .

CARDINAL . NORP On DATE ORG noted that the appeal had been lodged on DATE and consequently had to be rejected as out of time ( neblagovremen ; see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . ORG bench again included judge PERSON and the applicant received this decision on DATE .

CARDINAL . The relevant domestic provisions are contained in LAW ( PERSON o krivičnom postupku , published in ORG of GPE nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL and CARDINAL/CARDINAL , as well as in ORG – OG RS – nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . DATE ( CARDINAL ) provides that a judge may not sit in a case when he or she has already taken part in the adoption of a decision before a lower court or before “ the same court ” should its decision subsequently “ be appealed ” .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides , inter alia , that as soon as a judge discovers this ground for recusal , he or she shall cease dealing with the case and request the president of the court to appoint another judge in his or her stead .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides , inter alia , that a defendant who has been sentenced to a prison term shall have the right to file his submissions through the prison authorities , thereby interrupting any time - limits .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides , inter alia , that a time - limit set in DATE shall expire by DATE , of DATE , which corresponds by number to the date when the running of the time - limit commenced .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL provides , inter alia , that the competent public prosecutor “ may ” ( može ) file a Request for ORG ( zahtev za zaštitu zakonitosti ) against a “ final judicial decision ” , on behalf of or against the defendant , if the relevant substantive and/or procedural “ law has been breached ” ( ako je povređen zakon ) .

CARDINAL . On the basis of the above request , under Articles CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL , ORG may uphold the conviction at issue or reverse it . It may also quash the impugned judgment , in its entirety or partly , and order a re - trial before the lower courts . If ORG , however , finds that there has been a violation of the law in favour of the defendant , it shall only be authorised to declare so but shall leave the final judgment standing .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL provides , inter alia , that a defendant who has been found guilty and sentenced to an effective prison term at first and second instance shall have the right to file an appeal on points of law ( zahtev za ispitivanje zakonitosti pravosnažne presude ) with ORG within DATE as of the date of receipt of the judgment rendered on appeal .

CARDINAL . NORP In accordance with Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL and CARDINAL , inter alia , ORG shall , should it accept an appeal on points of law , have the power to overturn the impugned judgment or quash it and order a retrial before the lower courts . It shall also be able to do so if there are serious doubts as to the veracity of the decisive facts established in the impugned decision and this impinges upon the proper application of the relevant law .

CARDINAL . In DATE amendments to MONEY ( Zakon o izmenama i dopunama PERSON o krivičnom postupku , published in ORG no . CARDINAL ) removed the appeal on points of law as an existing domestic remedy . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of this Act , however , provides that in respect of all defendants who had already lodged their appeals on points of law before the entry into force of these amendments it is the “ repealed provisions ” that shall be applicable .

CARDINAL . Lastly , in its decision of CARDINAL DATE ORG held that a Request for ORG is not a remedy which needs to be exhausted before one may file an appeal with ORG , the reason being , inter alia , that it was only the public prosecutor who could have filed such a request on behalf of the defendant and , further , that the former had full discretion in respect of whether to do so ( Už-CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .
